    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteModel

        public RemoteModel(String sparqlEndpointUrl,
                   String bulkEndpointUrl,
                   Map<String,Object> defaultParams)
        Create a new RemoteModel, pointing to an enhanced Joseki endpoint.
        Parameters:
        sparqlEndpointUrl - The SPARQL endpoint URL (usually "http://host/parliament/sparql").
        bulkEndpointUrl - The Bulk endpoint URL (usually "http://host/parliament/bulk").

      • insertStatements

        public void insertStatements(String serializedStatements,
                             String format,
                             String base)
                      throws IOException
        Insert data into the default graph of the remote KB.
        Parameters:
        serializedStatements - The statements in serialized form
        format - Format of the data. One of "RDF/XML","N3","N-TRIPLES"
        base - The base uri to be used when converting relative URI's to absolute URI's. The base URI may be null if there are no relative URIs to convert.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • insertStatements

        public void insertStatements(String serializedStatements,
                             String format,
                             String base,
                             boolean verifyData)
                      throws IOException
        Insert data into the default graph of the remote KB.
        Parameters:
        serializedStatements - The statements in serialized form
        format - Format of the data. One of "RDF/XML","N3","N-TRIPLES"
        base - The base uri to be used when converting relative URI's to absolute URI's. The base URI may be null if there are no relative URIs to convert.
        verifyData - Whether or not to verify that the data is valid before inserting statements
        Throws:
        IOException

      • insertStatements

                             String format,
                             String base,
                             String namedGraphURI)
                      throws IOException

        Parameters:
        serializedStatements - The statements in serialized form
        format - Format of the data. One of "RDF/XML","N3","N-TRIPLES"
        base - The base uri to be used when converting relative URI's to absolute URI's. The base URI may be null if there are no relative URIs to convert.
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the graph to insert into

        IOException

      • internalInsertStatements

        protected void internalInsertStatements(Object serializedStatements,
                                        String format,
                                        String base,
                                        String namedGraphURI,
                                        boolean verifyData)
                                 throws IOException
        Insert data into the remote KB in the specified named graph.
        Parameters:
        serializedStatements - The statements in serialized form. This should be either a String or an InputStream.
        format - Format of the data. One of "RDF/XML","N3","N-TRIPLES"
        base - The base uri to be used when converting relative URI's to absolute URI's. The base URI may be null if there are no relative URIs to convert.
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the graph to insert into
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createNamedGraph

        public void createNamedGraph(String namedGraphURI)
                      throws IOException
        Create a new named graph in the repository.
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to create
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createNamedGraph

        public void createNamedGraph(String namedGraphURI,
                             boolean silent)
                      throws IOException
        Create a new named graph in the repository.
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to create
        silent - The SPARQL/Update service generates an error if the graph referred by the URI already exists unless the SILENT is set to true, then no error is generated and execution of the sequence of SPARQL/Update operations continues.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • dropNamedGraph

        public void dropNamedGraph(String namedGraphURI)
                    throws IOException
        Drops the specified named graph from the repository (this can handle dropping Union graphs as well).
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to drop
        Throws:
        IOException

      • dropNamedGraph

        public void dropNamedGraph(String namedGraphURI,
                           boolean silent)
                    throws IOException
        Drops the specified named graph from the repository (this can handle dropping Union graphs as well).
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to drop
        silent - The SPARQL/Update service, by default, is expected to generate an error if the specified named graph does not exist. If SILENT is true, this error is ignored and execution of a sequence of SPARQL/Update operations continues.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createNamedUnionGraph

        public void createNamedUnionGraph(String namedUnionGraphURI,
                                  String leftGraphURI,
                                  String rightGraphURI)
                           throws IOException
        Create a new Union named graph in the repository.
        Parameters:
        namedUnionGraphURI - The uri of the named graph to create
        leftGraphURI - The first named graph in the union
        rightGraphURI - The second named graph in the union
        Throws:
        IOException

      • clear

        public void clear(String namedGraphURI)
           throws IOException
        Clears all of the statements in the given named graph. Note: does not remove the named graph itself.
        Parameters:
        namedGraphURI - URI of the named graph to clear
        Throws:
        IOException

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
              throws IOException
        Clears the entire repository.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • sendRequest

        private InputStream sendRequest(HashMap<String,Object> params)
                         throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • sendRequest

        private InputStream sendRequest(HashMap<String,Object> params,
                                String endpointUrl,
                                boolean multipart)
                         throws IOException
        Sends an HTTP-POST request with the supplied params to the given URL. The server's response is checked, throwing an exception when it indicates an error. Otherwise, the data returned by the server is returned as an InputStream.
        Parameters:
        params - The parameters for the POST request
        endpointUrl - The URL to post the data to
        multipart - Whether to send this request as "multipart/form-data" or "x-www-url-encoded"
        Returns:
        An InputStream containing the data that was returned by the server.
        Throws:
        IOException - In case of an error in the request or in the processing of it by the server.

      • checkResponse

                    throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException
